Description: Ostracon of coarse red pottery, inscribed on the original exterior surface with parts of 5 lines of Meroitic text in black ink. A portion is missing from the left side.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: University of Colorado Museum
Curator's comments: Lister, F., Ceramic Studies of the Historic Periods in Ancient Nubia. University of Utah Anthropological Papers, no. 86. Salt Lake City, 1967, p. 69. See also William Y Adams, The West Bank Survey from Faras to Gemai. Sudan Archaeological Research Society Publication Number 13. BAR International Series 1335 (2005).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (395034) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/395034)
Acquisition name: Donated by: University of Colorado Museum
